009package imagingbook.core.resource;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.ImagePlus;
013
014/**
015 * <p>
016 * Named image resource types implement this interface.
017 * This indicates (for testing) that the associated resource can be opened as
018 * an image (by ImageJ).
019 * Extends interface {@link NamedResource} by adding method {@link #getImage()},
020 * which returns an {@link ImagePlus} instance.
021 * So this can be used, e.g., on the named resource {@code MyImages.image1}, simply in the form
022 * </p>
023 * <pre>
024 * ImagePlus im = MyImages.image1.getImage();
025 * im.show();
026 * </pre>
027 * 
028 * @author WB
029 *
030 */
031public interface ImageResource extends NamedResource {
032        
033        public default ImagePlus getImage() {
034                return IJ.openImage(getURL().toString());
035        }
036
037}
